Key Match Events: Kagiso Rabada had Liam Livingstone caught at deep backward square
Marco Jansen sent down a phenomenal penultimate over, conceding only seven runs
Anrich Nortje successfully defended 13 runs in the final over
Jos Buttler leapt one-handed to his left and hung on to a humdinger catch
Heinrich Klaasen was slow between the wickets and Buttler pounced, showing incredible awareness and aim to throw the stumps down at the non-striker's end with Klaasen well short
Reeza Hendricks grabbed on to the first chance they were given
Keshav Maharaj tossed the ball up, Bairstow cut and Nortje flung himself to his right at backward point to grab a stunner
Markram took a spectacular catch over his right shoulder to dismiss Harry Brook
Post-Match Reflections: England may not be unhappy after the close defeat, with a positive net run rate and a game against the USA to come
South Africa's time may have come, after beating defending champions England in a thrilling encounter
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa scored 163 for 6 in their innings
England scored 156 for 6 in their innings
The match was played at Gros Islet, June 21, 2024, as part of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup
